link.synopsis: Restless and ready for adventure, four suburban bikers (Tim Allen, Martin Lawrence, William H. Macy and John Travolta) leave the safety of their subdivision and head out on the open road. But complications ensue when they cross paths with an intimidating band of New Mexico bikers known as the Del Fuegos. Jill Hennessy, Marisa Tomei and Ray Liotta also star in this freewheeling comedy from director Walt Becker.
link.title: synopsis
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
What's the Worst That Could Happen?
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold

link.synopsis: Eccentric performer and romantic skeptic Charlyne Yi embarks on a quest to learn the true nature of love -- and gathers some surprising findings when she begins a relationship with actor Michael Cera. Real-life sweethearts Yi and Cera star as themselves in this quirky hybrid of documentary and scripted comedy. The charming romance was nominated for the Grand Jury Prize at the 2009 Sundance Film Festival.
link.title: synopsis
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: Proudly plus-sized funnyman Gabriel Iglesias puts the crowd in stitches with this stand-up comedy performance filmed live in 2009 at The Plaza Theatre in El Paso, Texas, where he shares his uncensored perspective on the crazy side of life. Known for his hilarious character voices and his uncannily lifelike squeals, screeches and other sound effects, the award-winning Iglesias delivers a performance you won't soon forget.
link.title: synopsis
Carlos Mencia: Not for the Easily Offended: Live in San Jose
The Original Latin Kings of Comedy
John Pinette: I Say Nay Nay
Ralphie May: Girth of a Nation
Pablo Francisco: Ouch! Live from San Jose
Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin
Carlos Mencia: The Best of "Funny Is Funny"
Paul Rodriguez's Latin All-Stars of Comedy: Vol. 1
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Jeff Foxworthy: You Might Be a Redneck / Check Your Neck
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Guy Torry's Phat Comedy Tuesdays: Vol. 2
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy

title.regular: Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy

link.synopsis: After publishing a popular guide to successful marriage, lesbian therapists and long-time couple Dyna and Kit decide to break up -- a situation made more difficult when a documentary crew arrives to film their private lives in this Web comedy series.
link.title: synopsis
We Have to Stop Now: Season 1
The Ultimate Lesbian Short Film Festival
Edie & Thea: A Very Long Engagement

link.synopsis: A hilarious and heartfelt military comedy-drama co-directed by John Ford and Mervyn LeRoy, Mister Roberts stars Henry Fonda as an officer who's yearning for battle but is stuck in the backwaters of World War II on a noncommissioned Navy ship run by the bullying Capt. Morton (James Cagney). Jack Lemmon enjoys a star-making turn as the freewheeling Ensign Pulver, and William Powell stars as the ship's doctor in his last screen role.
link.title: synopsis
James Cagney Collection: The Time of Your Life
No Time for Love / The Egg and I
The Battle of the River Plate

link.synopsis: This vintage romantic comedy from director Robert Hamer stars Alec Guinness as Sir Edgar Fraser, a middle-aged aristocrat who journeys to Paris with his twentysomething son, John (Vernon Gray), in order to find the lad a girlfriend. But John hatches his own scheme to land his lonesome pop a woman -- and soon the two become entangled with cute shopgirls, blue-blooded dames and one madcap misunderstanding after another.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit
The Last Time I Saw Paris

link.synopsis: Dracula, the Wolfman, Frankenstein, the Mummy and Gill Man descend on a tiny town in search of a diabolically powerful amulet. But only 12-year-old Sean (Andre Gower) and his gang of monster-obsessed misfits can save the day in this overlooked 1987 horror comedy. This 20th-anniversary edition also includes new interviews with Gower and co-stars Ryan Lambert, Duncan Regehr, Tom Noonan and writer-director Fred Dekker.
link.title: synopsis
My Best Friend Is a Vampire
The Worst Horror Movie Ever Made
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie

link.synopsis: Bookish and unpopular Mandy (Ashley Tisdale) finds her luck finally changing when Drew (Robbie Amell), the school hottie, invites her to the year's biggest party. But with being grounded and Drew's ex-girlfriend bent on thwarting her, Mandy may be destined to remain a geek. Can a little ingenuity and some help from her friends save the day? Maxim Roy, Shenae Grimes, Kevin Pollak and Marie-Marguerite Sabongui co-star in this family comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Ashley Tisdale: There's Something About Ashley: The Story of Headstrong
The Prince & Me 3: A Royal Honeymoon
I Love You, I Love You Not

link.synopsis: After catching her husband (Kevin Bacon) in a compromising position, Anne Devereaux (Renée Zellweger) rounds up her teenage sons and hits the road, hoping to find a wealthy new man to care for her family in this comedy based on the real-life childhood of actor George Hamilton. Anne finds no shortage of admirers -- and on her quest for a husband, she soon discovers herself. Eric McCormack, Logan Lerman and Nick Stahl co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Private Lives of Pippa Lee
The Other End of the Line
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: Driven away from their prehistoric homeland by an earthquake, a caveman (voiced by Nicolas Cage) and his family (Catherine Keener and Emma Stone) forge a fresh start in unfamiliar terrain. But when they cross paths with a quirky innovator (Ryan Reynolds), it threatens the traditional way of life they've always known. Kirk De Micco and Chris Sanders direct this animated Dreamworks comedy about coming to grips with change.
link.title: synopsis
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit
Scooby-Doo and the Legend of the Vampire

link.synopsis: Ninety-year-old Morris Applebaum (played by Peter Falk, aka Lt. Columbo) has decided to "check out" on life and gathers his grown-up children to his Manhattan apartment for a final reunion. Based on the Broadway play by Allen Swift, this witty comedy shows that all families are enduring and, hopefully, endearing. The film, co-starring Laura San Giacomo, David Paymer and Judge Reinhold, grabbed the attention of film festivals across the country.
link.title: synopsis
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: On a daily commute from Orange County to downtown Los Angeles, an unnamed driver (writer-director Marc Wasserman) watches his life pass him by while he fights insufferable gridlock and creeps along one of the busiest freeways in the country. This satirical look at life in the slow lane features standout performances from a hilarious cast, including actor Tom Sizemore's show-stopping turn as The Almighty himself.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Celebrating the Art of the Short Film
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail

link.synopsis: In director Steve Carr's sequel to the urban comedy Friday, the streetwise Craig Jones (Ice Cube) is still rooming at his parents' house in South Central Los Angeles when he learns that his archnemesis, Debo (Tommy "Tiny" Lister), has broken out of jail. Craig's father ships his slacker son to uncle Elroy's (Don "DC" Curry) house in the suburbs. But new problems arise -- not the least of which is the girl next door.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking Your Juice in the Hood
House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute

link.synopsis: Director Woody Allen's Oscar-nominated comedy set in 1940s Brooklyn draws heavily on his youth -- a time when radio was king. Through vignettes woven together by music from the era, the film focuses on young Joe (Seth Green) and his houseful of relatives. His father (Michael Tucker) craves news from Europe, his aunt (Dianne Wiest) is obsessed with marriage, and his mother (Julie Kavner) is appalled that Joe has bought a secret decoder ring.
link.title: synopsis
Three Men and a Little Lady
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: This romantic dark comedy stars film legend Peter O'Toole (who earned an Oscar nod for his performance) as veteran actor Maurice, a man whose quiet golden years turn topsy-turvy when he falls for a young and brash nude model (Jodie Whittaker). Director Roger Michell's poignant May-December romance is an uplifting tale of love, lust and the endless pursuit of vitality and youth by a man whose life is drawing to a close.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee

link.title: Love and Death on Long Island
The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp
The Sinister Saga of Making The Stunt Man

link.synopsis: With his department in danger of being cut, high school drama teacher Dana Marschz (Steve Coogan) pens a heretical sequel to William Shakespeare's "Hamlet" and exhorts his students to stage it in this sardonic comedy that riffs on the "inspirational teacher" genre. Catherine Keener plays Marschz's unhappy wife, with Elisabeth Shue appearing as herself -- or, rather, a version of herself who's given up acting to become a nurse.
link.title: synopsis
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
Assassination of a High School President

link.synopsis: Two teens try to destroy a suburban family in director Robert Altman's risqué comedy, which follows misfits O.C. Ogilvie (Daniel Jenkins) and Mark Stiggs (Neill Barry), who see red when an insurance salesman cancels the policy of O.C.'s grampa (Ray Walston). Bent on revenge, the youngsters carry out a vendetta against the loutish salesman (Paul Dooley). The high-powered cast includes Jane Curtin, Martin Mull, Dennis Hopper and Louis Nye.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Mischief-prone Army buddies Dorain "Dodo" Doubleday (William Tracy) and Officer Ames (Joe Sawyer) reteam for another slapstick comedy … but this time, World War II is over, and they're clothed as working-class civilians. Now, earning their livings as a newspaper reporter and a police officer, respectively, the fumbling friends find themselves at the center of a blackmail case that takes a nosedive into murder.
link.title: synopsis
The Emperor's Naked Army Marches On
My Sister Eileen / She Wouldn't Say Yes
Behind the Planet of the Apes
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
The Three Stooges: Three Smart Saps
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick
My Friend Irma / My Friend Irma Goes West
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
The Three Stooges: All Time Favorites
Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army

link.synopsis: Frankie Muniz reprises his role as teenage CIA operative Cody Banks, who goes undercover to infiltrate a prestigious London boarding school -- posing as a gifted music student -- when his former mentor steals a dangerous mind-control device.
link.title: synopsis
Spy Kids 2: The Island of Lost Dreams
Wizards of Waverly Place: The Movie
Spy Kids: All the Time in the World
Kim Possible Movie: So the Drama
R.L. Stine's The Haunting Hour: Don't Think About It
Transformers Animated: Transform and Roll Out

link.synopsis: When bride-to-be Cyd Merriman (Brooke Nevin) considers selling her small-town dance studio, she discovers that her estranged father, Tanner Grey (John Schneider), is listed on the deed. Meeting for the first time, the two must decide what to do with the studio -- and each other. As Cyd prepares for her wedding, Tanner helps by teaching dance classes. But fiancé Zach (Christopher Jacot) isn't as welcoming, and Tanner makes an uneasy decision.
link.title: synopsis
What If God Were the Sun?
Trees Grow Tall and Then They Fall
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants

link.synopsis: Disgusted with her habit of drinking too much and waking up next to strangers, thirtysomething Lucy (Ashley Judd) re-evaluates her small-town Southern life. But rectifying her present involves delving into her past -- which involves getting to know her family. Director Joey Lauren Adams (Chasing Amy) also wrote the screenplay for this independent drama about ending unhealthy habits and getting it right.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Three Ways to Get a Husband

link.synopsis: After rounding up 100 women who are willing to move to 19th-century Seattle and wed bachelors working at their logging camp, the exhausted Bolt brothers (Robert Brown, David Soul and teen idol Bobby Sherman) are well on their way to saving the family business  in this classic 1960s television series. But if any lady leaves before the end of the year is up, the Bolts will lose everything they own. Joan Blondell co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
Here Come the Brides: Season 1: Disc 1
Here Come the Brides: Season 1: Disc 2
Here Come the Brides: Season 1: Disc 3
Here Come the Brides: Season 1: Disc 4
Here Come the Brides: Season 1: Disc 5
Here Come the Brides: Season 1: Disc 6
The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp: From Ellsworth to Tombstone
Lone Ranger: Enter the Lone Ranger
Legends of the Old West: Stories of the Century: Vol. 3
Legends of the Old West: Stories of the Century: Vol. 2
Legends of the Old West: Stories of the Century: Vol. 4

link.synopsis: Stuck in a dead-end job and saddled with an abusive husband, Cecilia (Mia Farrow) depends on the movies for her escape. She sees one picture, The Purple Rose of Cairo, so often that the film's star (Jeff Daniels) walks off the screen and into her life … and promptly falls in love with her. Writer-director Woody Allen's touching romantic comedy bagged a Golden Globe for Best Screenplay and was nominated for a host of foreign and critics' awards.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie

link.synopsis: The no-holds-barred Pythons explore the various facets of life -- from procreation to the clang of a death knell -- in their typical irreverent fashion, proclaiming "Every sperm is sacred." (Or didn't you know?) Darker and more disturbing than other Monty Python fare, the film follows a sketch comedy format and includes highlights such as the heave-inducing "world's biggest glutton" skit featuring John Cleese and Terry Jones.
link.title: synopsis
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Eric Idle's Personal Best
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Graham Chapman's Personal Best
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Terry Gilliam's Personal Best
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Michael Palin's Personal Best
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Terry Jones' Personal Best
John Cleese on How to Irritate People
Orgies and the Meaning of Life
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension

title.regular: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
title.short: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life

link.synopsis: After undergoing plastic surgery and a complete fashion makeover, suddenly sexy journalist Tamara (Gemma Arterton) triumphantly returns to her tiny hometown, where she exploits her irresistible appeal by recklessly toying with others' emotions and breaking hearts. Adapted from a comic strip by Posy Simmonds, this Stephen Frears-directed comedy explores themes such as unrequited loved, envy and lust.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
A Woman, a Gun and a Noodle Shop

link.synopsis: In this numbskulls-plan-a-heist comedy, three shiftless friends of San Francisco pawnshop owner Lou Garvey decide to rob the store while Garvey's out of town -- and each finds a way to mess up the plan.
link.title: synopsis
Harry and Walter Go to New York
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
The Great Bank Hoax / The Great Bank Robbery

link.synopsis: After a House of Lords member dies during a bizarre cross-dressing ritual, his nutty son, Jack (Peter O'Toole) -- who thinks he's Jesus Christ -- is bequeathed the family estate. As a result, his family members must scheme to steal back Jack's inheritance. This 1972 cult comedy, in all its murder and mayhem glory, takes a swipe at every swath of class-obsessed British society. Arthur Lowe shines as Jack's lucky servant, Tucker.
link.title: synopsis
Adolf Hitler: My Part in His Downfall
The Man in the White Suit
How to Get Ahead in Advertising

link.synopsis: Drafted into the military near the end of World War II, lazy yet crafty civilian pilot Archie (Robert Mitchum) exudes the confidence of a general, which allows him to avoid annoying assignments, sneak off base with his new girlfriend and become a celebrated hero. Director Jack Webb co-stars in this comedy as Bowers, Archie's loyal sidekick who can't muster the same level of bravado as his best friend.
link.title: synopsis
What Did You Do in the War, Daddy?
Adolf Hitler: My Part in His Downfall
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
The Man in the White Suit
I Was a Male War Bride
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium

title.regular: The Last Time I Saw Archie
title.short: The Last Time I Saw Archie

link.synopsis: After losing their high-paying corporate jobs, Jane and Dick Harper (Jim Carrey and Téa Leoni) turn to robbing banks to maintain their upwardly mobile standard of living in this action-comedy based on the 1977 film of the same name. The couple's hold-up act begins as a desperate measure. But before long, they're actually enjoying it -- and now it's getting to be a habit. Alec Baldwin, Richard Jenkins and Angie Harmon co-star.
link.title: synopsis
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
The Great Bank Hoax / The Great Bank Robbery

link.synopsis: When Hong Kong  Inspector Lee (Jackie Chan, doing his own amazing stunts) is summoned to Los Angeles to investigate a kidnapping, the FBI doesn't want any outside help and assigns cocky LAPD Detective James Carter (Chris Tucker) to distract Lee from the case. Not content to watch the action from the sidelines, Lee and Carter form an unlikely partnership and investigate the case themselves in this action-packed buddy comedy
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in China 2

link.synopsis: An outrageous comedy from the Farrelly Brothers, the film centers around mild-mannered Charlie (Jim Carrey), a Rhode Island cop with split-personality disorder who escorts Irene (Renee Zellweger) back to her home town -- and loses his medication on the trip. Charlie and his hyper-aggressive alter-ego both fall in love with the confused Irene, and he wages war - with himself - for her affections while running from a group of corrupt officers.
link.title: synopsis
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Writer-director Whit Stillman's witty comedy of manners (which won an Independent Spirit Award for Best First Feature) pokes gentle fun at a group of upper-class Manhattan preppies who gather regularly to play bridge and engage in intellectual discussion. Led by acerbic cynic Nick (Christopher Eigeman), the coterie adopts "proletariat" Tom Townsend (Edward Clements), who has reservations about his new socialite friends and what they represent.
link.title: synopsis
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
How to Get Ahead in Advertising

link.synopsis: Playful circus chimp Ham III -- grandson of the first simian astronaut -- finds himself knee-deep in an intergalactic revolution when NASA drafts him to recover a missing probe in this animated comedy adventure. Can Ham and his shipmates, the intrepid Lt. Luna and testy skipper Titan, save a planet under the thumb of a nefarious tyrant? Celebrity voices include Andy Samberg, Cheryl Hines, Patrick Warburton, Jeff Daniels and Stanley Tucci.
link.title: synopsis
The True Story of Puss 'n Boots
Stuart Little 3: Call of the Wild
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore
The Secret of NIMH 2: Timmy to the Rescue

link.synopsis: Returning from their latest stint in jail, boozy pals Julian (John Paul Tremblay), Bubbles (Mike Smith) and Ricky (Robb Wells) plan to go legit once and for all -- only to find old nemesis Jim (John Dunsworth), the newly sober manager of their trailer park, preparing to demolish their homes. Now their white trash war might drive the boys back to crime and Jim back to the bottle. Mike Clattenburg directs this comedy based on the television series.
link.title: synopsis
Larry the Cable Guy: Tailgate Party
Shoot First and Pray You Live
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America: A Final Night with George W. Bush

title.regular: Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
title.short: Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day

link.synopsis: After failing to find true love in any of his past relationships, Chris Waitt resolves to discover exactly what is wrong with him. Thinking that others have a better idea of his faults than he does, he sets out to find and question old girlfriends. This humorous documentary follows lonely loser Chris as he looks for answers not only from past flames, but also from medical practitioners and his mother.
link.title: synopsis
Private Practices: The Story of a Sex Surrogate
Starz Inside: The Face Is Familiar
Starz Inside: Sex and the Cinema
Edie & Thea: A Very Long Engagement
This Film Is Not Yet Rated
Me and You and Everyone We Know

title.regular: A Complete History of My Sexual Failures
title.short: A Complete History of My Sexual Failures

link.synopsis: Things get mighty sticky in this affably offbeat indie comedy when Jimmy (Hiroshi Watanabe) -- a hapless 40-year-old divorcé who shares a bunk bed with his 10-year-old nephew (Justin Kwong) -- falls for his brother-in-law's charming niece, Ramona (Lynn Chen). Hoping to stage a romantic comeback, Jimmy plans an enchanting outing at a dinosaur park. Unfortunately, Ramona doesn't seem to be over her ex (James Kyson Lee), Jimmy's much cooler co-worker.
link.title: synopsis
Me and You and Everyone We Know
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle

link.synopsis: Blending the comedy stylings of Bill Cosby, Steve Martin and Paul Reiser, funnyman Kenn Kington serves up an offbeat take on the craziness life dishes out. Kington's topics on this hilarious program include "Answers to Questions I Don't Have," "Sharing Tongues," "Duck Hunting Made Easy," "Married Stuff I Don't Understand," "A Little White Spider," "Halloween Candy," "Rocks & Snakes," "Pee-Wee Football" and more.
link.title: synopsis
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Bob & Tom: Comedy All Stars Tour
Bobby Slayton: Born to Be Bobby
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour
Bob & Tom Radio: The Comedy Tour
Greg Behrendt: Is That Guy from That Thing
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
The Gospel Comedy All-Stars 3:  Don't Judge Me!
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Kevin Nealon: Now Hear Me Out!
John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey

link.synopsis: Talented, hardworking Shekhar (Akshaye Khanna) finds his Bollywood dreams shattered when the buffoonish Chandu (Arshad Warsi) steals his screenplay and rides it to superstardom. Distraught and subsequently deserted by his wife (Amrita Rao), Shekhar vows revenge. Twists of fate reunite the rivals in hilarious ways in this zany comedy shot in Thailand and produced by Anil Kapoor (Slumdog Millionaire).
link.title: synopsis
Beats of the Heart: There'll Always Be Stars in the Sky: The Indian Film Music Phenomenon

link.synopsis: Poking fun at corseted Edwardian period dramas, this witty comedy of manners stars Georgina Cates as 22-year-old Emily, an upper-crust lass who rejects the boorish would-be suitor picked out by her snobby aunt (Prunella Scales) in favor of handsome peasant George (Sean Pertwee). Will the differences in their social standing keep Emily and George apart? Samuel West co-stars as Emily's flighty brother.
link.title: synopsis
Terry Jones: The Hidden History of Rome
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

link.synopsis: Most 1970s blaxploitation vehicles function as violent, sociological artifacts with soulful soundtracks. This raucous urban action-comedy delivers genuine laughs. Gravedigger Jones (Godfrey Cambridge) and Coffin Ed Johnson (Raymond St. Jacques) are rascally uptown cops, suspicious that a slick reverend is fleecing his flock. Redd Foxx and Cleavon Little spice up this streetwise caper, which includes eye-catching shots of Harlem circa 1970.
link.title: synopsis
Bring Me the Head of Alfredo Garcia

link.synopsis: Compulsive gambler Jih (Tai-bao) tries to bamboozle dim-bulb gang boss Black Dog (Chen-Nan Tsai) in this satirical action-comedy that pokes fun at Taiwanese culture. To fend off Black Dog's attempt to collect a gaming debt, Jih says he can't repay the money because he needs it for the funeral of his father (Bin-hui Lee) -- who once saved the mafioso's life. Trouble is, Jih's father is alive, and Black Dog plans to attend the memorial service.
link.title: synopsis
The Butcher, the Chef and the Swordsman
Dr. Wai in the Scripture with No Words
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro
Kung Fu Mahjong 3: The Final Duel
Love Is a Many Stupid Thing
A Woman, a Gun and a Noodle Shop
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage

link.synopsis: This Comedy Central special features red-hot actor and stand-up comedian Aziz Ansari performing at Los Angeles's Brentwood Theater, where the funnyman offers up an uncensored routine to a house crammed with enthusiastic fans. As a bonus treat, the co-star of MTV's hit sketch show "Human Giant" and popular network sitcom "Parks and Recreation" trots out his foulmouthed hip-hop alternate persona, Randy.
link.title: synopsis
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Zach Galifianakis: Live at the Purple Onion
Platinum Comedy Series: Tracy Morgan: Life, Love & Lust
Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Comedians of Comedy: Live at the Troubadour
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Kevin Hart: I'm a Grown Little Man
Russell Brand in New York City
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Penn & Teller: Off the Deep End
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Richard Pryor: I Ain't Dead Yet #*%$#@!! Uncensored
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!

title.regular: Aziz Ansari: Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening

link.synopsis: When his family falls prey to kidnappers while on holiday in Spain, Wall Street whiz kid Will Shaw frantically sets out to get them back -- but discovers that the trail leads back to his own father and the secrets he keeps.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Director Craig Moss (who brought the world Saving Ryan's Privates) takes aim at the conventions of hit comedies -- and at least one Oscar-winning drama -- and amps up their most memorable moments in search of more laughs in this farcical parody. As the title suggests, the film pokes fun at The 40-Year-Old Virgin, Knocked Up, Forgetting Sarah Marshall and Superbad, but it also takes a few swipes at Slumdog Millionaire, too.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th

title.regular: The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It

link.synopsis: Precocious youngster Eddie Lucca (Ian Hawkes)  narrates this whimsical comedy about the romantic escapades of his parents, gambling dreamer Danilo (Joseph Long) and practical Rosa (Anita Zagaria), who defied their families by leaving Italy and opening a small restaurant in London. Along with their three older children and Rosa's grumpy mother, the couple tries to stave off both bankruptcy and Rosa's spurned suitor from the old country.
link.title: synopsis
The Favor, the Watch and the Very Big Fish
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
The Lonely Passion of Judith Hearne

link.synopsis: When circus owner Max passes away, he bequeaths to Foster (Tony Danza) $5 million and three orangutans. But Foster better take good care of the goofy primates or all the money goes to a greedy zoology society's honcho, Lazlo (Danny DeVito). Caring for primates isn't as easy as it looks -- but it sure is funny. Stacey Nelkin plays Foster's displeased girlfriend, Cynthia; Jeremy Joe Kronsberg writes and directs this high jinks-filled comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood
Home Is Where the Hart Is
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?
Take This Job and Shove It
See No Evil, Hear No Evil

link.synopsis: When a New York reporter (Linda Kozlowski) plucks crocodile hunter Dundee (Paul Hogan) from the Australian Outback for a visit to the Big Apple, it's a clash of cultures and a recipe for good-natured comedy as naïve Dundee negotiates the concrete jungle. Dundee proves that his instincts are quite useful in the city and adeptly handles everything from wily muggers to high-society snoots without breaking a sweat. Hogan's script earned an Oscar nod.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold
The Man with One Red Shoe
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition

link.synopsis: Victoria Grant (Julie Andrews) is a struggling soprano who, with help from a fellow performer (Robert Preston), finally finds success by posing as a male female impersonator. But what will happen when a nightclub owner (James Garner) finds himself attracted to Victoria's cross-dressing male persona and begins to suspect "Victor" is really a woman? This gender-bending musical comedy received seven Oscar nominations and won for Best Score.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.title: The Return of the Pink Panther
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series

link.synopsis: Alex's (Daniel Brühl) mother (Katrin Sass) falls into a coma just as the Berlin Wall is about to come down. But when she wakes up eight months later, her heart is too weak to withstand shock -- so Alex goes to great lengths to keep the truth about her country's reform a secret. Wolfgang Becker directs this widely praised, Golden Globe-nominated comedy set in East Germany in 1989 that played in festivals around the world.
link.title: synopsis
My Brother Is an Only Child
The Giallo Collection: Short Night of Glass Dolls

link.synopsis: Everything's going great between baseball fanatic Ben (Jimmy Fallon) and his new girlfriend, Lindsay (Drew Barrymore). But when spring rolls around and baseball season begins, Ben's overwhelming obsession with the Boston Red Sox threatens to destroy their relationship. Ione Skye and Kadee Strickland co-star in this Farrelly brothers comedy based on Nick Hornby's novel, which originally had its protagonist obsessed with soccer.
link.title: synopsis
Still, We Believe: The Boston Red Sox Movie
The Cutting Edge: Going for the Gold
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
4192: The Crowning of the Hit King
The Bingo Long Traveling All-Stars and Motor Kings
Take Me Out to the Ball Game

link.synopsis: In this follow-up to the 2003 comedy Bruce Almighty, God summons narcissistic newscaster-turned-congressman Evan to build an ark in preparation for a devastating flood. Meanwhile, Evan's perplexed family interprets his new hobby as a midlife crisis.
link.title: synopsis
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry

link.synopsis: Rather than living his last days to the fullest after he learns that he only has six weeks left on Earth, Henry Poole (Luke Wilson) cuts himself off from his fiancée and his family -- and binges on Twinkies, pizza and liquor. But a fortuitous miracle and a clash with his eccentric, meddling neighbors derail Henry's plans in director Mark Pellington's witty comedy. Cheryl Hines and George Lopez also star.
link.title: synopsis
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
Dim Sum: A Little Bit of Heart
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family

link.synopsis: Tales of mixed identities, personal ads, gay cartoon cowboys, passive aggression and more are collected in these seven hilarious, gay-themed shorts, which have been honored at such festivals and ceremonies as the Sundance Film Festival, the U.S. Comedy Arts Festival and the PlanetOut Awards. The films are Available Men, Straight Boys, Hello Thanks, The Underminer, Sissy French Fry, Tumbleweed Town, and Irene Williams: Queen of Lincoln Rd.
link.title: synopsis
The Best of Boys in Love
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them 2
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them

link.synopsis: Upstart comedian Lenny Bruce is the subject of this documentary by Fred Baker that features performance footage of Bruce's stand-up comedy and interviews with those who knew him best. Ahead of his time, Bruce was persecuted for dishing out anti-establishment humor in a decidedly conservative era. Steve Allen, Paul Krassner, Mort Sahl, Kenneth Tynan, Nat Hentoff and Malcolm Muggeridge share personal memories of Bruce in candid video memoirs.
link.title: synopsis
Sam Kinison: Why Did We Laugh?
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
A Walk into the Sea: Danny Williams and the Warhol Factory
William S. Burroughs: A Man Within
George Carlin: On Location With George Carlin
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey
Too Tough To Die: A Tribute To Johnny Ramone
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project
Andy Kaufman: World Inter-Gender Wrestling Champion
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie
George Carlin: Jammin' in New York
Basic Black: The Lewis Black Story
Buy the Ticket, Take the Ride
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
George Carlin: Playing with Your Head
The Gospel According to Philip K. Dick
Art Pepper: Notes from a Jazz Survivor
Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle
Harlan Ellison: Dreams with Sharp Teeth
George Carlin: What Am I Doing in New Jersey?
George Carlin: You are All Diseased
Classic Albums: John Lennon: Plastic Ono Band

link.synopsis: Mel (Matthew Modine) is a jazz musician with a serious lust for women of all types. When he finally decides to commit to his girlfriend, Inga (Ewa Da Cruz), fate delivers the ultimate test of fidelity in the form of an attractive biologist (Gina Gershon) who sublets Mel's apartment. Toss in a beautiful bride-to-be (Christy Cashman), whom Mel falls for, and you have all the ingredients for a classic romantic screwball comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this wacky comedy, three New York drag queens (Wesley Snipes, Patrick Swayze and John Leguizamo) on their way to Hollywood for a beauty pageant get stranded in a small Midwestern town for the entire weekend when their car breaks down. While waiting for parts for their Cadillac convertible, the flamboyant trio shows the local homophobic rednecks that appearing different doesn't mean they don't have humanity in common.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion
What's the Worst That Could Happen?

title.regular: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
title.short: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything

link.synopsis: Tom (Steve Martin) and Kate Baker (Bonnie Hunt) continue to juggle the demands of an extra-large brood in this sequel that has the family meeting its nemesis in the form of the equally gigantic Murtaugh clan. Led by an overly competitive patriarch (Eugene Levy) and his sexy new wife (Carmen Electra), the Murtaughs are hell-bent on wrecking the Bakers' idyllic lake vacation in this supersized comedy co-starring Hillary Duff and Piper Perabo.
link.title: synopsis
Judy Moody and the Not Bummer Summer

link.synopsis: Winner of the award for Best Musical Comedy at the Cannes Film Festival, this star-studded production opens in heaven, with the late Broadway producer Florenz Ziegfeld looking down to earth and imagining a final lavish revue. A series of musical and comedy sketches follow, including dance numbers with Fred Astaire and Gene Kelly, an Esther Williams water ballet, a Red Skelton comedy routine and more. Lucille Ball and Judy Garland also appear.
link.title: synopsis
I Love Lucy: The Movie and Other Great Rarities
Birth of the Blues / Blue Skies: Double Feature
Juke Joint / Reet, Petite and Gone

link.synopsis: Decadent drifters Jean-Claude (Gérard Depardieu) and Pierrot (Patrick Dewaere), in an effort to flout bourgeois morality, go on a bizarre crime spree in director Bertrand Blier's provocative cult comedy that features an early appearance by Isabelle Huppert. The two vagabonds wander the French countryside looking for trouble -- and find it when they kidnap a jaded beautician (Miou-Miou) and cross paths with a lusty ex-convict (Jeanne Moreau).
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

link.synopsis: Movie star Laurel Stevens (Jane Russell) has a problem with her kidnappers Mike (Ralph Meeker) and Dandy (Keenan Wynn): they're not doing it right! First, she thinks she's worth more than their ransom demand. Worse, she's afraid the media believes her abduction is just a publicity stunt. As if the situation couldn't get any more complicated, Laurel's starting to fall for Mike. Fred Clark and Una Merkel co-star in this sidesplitting comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
There's No Business Like Show Business
The Man in the White Suit

link.synopsis: Indulging in alcohol and women to boost his ego, washed-up cowboy star Howard Spence (Sam Shepard) rides off the set of his latest movie and embarks on a journey of self-discovery in this drama from writer Shepard and director Wim Wenders. Spence tries to dry out at his mom's (Eva Marie Saint) house, but returns to his self-destructive ways until she reveals a secret that forces him to straighten out his life. Jessica Lange co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

link.synopsis: Jack McGurn (Dennis Quaid) and his Japanese wife struggle with racial prejudice in this romantic drama set in the 1930s. After moving to Los Angeles, the ex-union organizer falls for the pretty daughter, Lily (Tamlyn Tomita), of his boss, Hiroshi Kawamura (Sab Shimono). When Lily's dad disapproves, the couple flees to Seattle, where mixed-race marriages are legal. When World War II begins, Jack and Lily's world turns upside down.
link.title: synopsis
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: Director Bob Clark's infamous comedy takes an unabashed look at adolescence in the 1950s. Six teenagers, desperate to find sexual satisfaction at the notorious honky-tonk strip joint Porky's, are ripped off and thrown out. But Pee Wee (Dan Monahan), Tommy (Wyatt Knight), Billy (Mark Herrier) and Mickey (Roger Wilson) plot unforgettable revenge -- and wreak havoc on high school teachers Balbricker (Nancy Parsons) and Honeywell (Kim Cattrall).
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
Revenge of the Nerds IV: Nerds in Love
Revenge of the Nerds III: The Next Generation
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion

link.synopsis: This joyous Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers musical features an Irving Berlin score and the classic duet "Cheek to Cheek." Astaire stars as Jerry Travers, a singer-dancer who auditions some new moves for producer Horace Hardwick at his hotel. The beautiful Dale Tremont (Rogers) is staying downstairs and the wackiness begins when she mistakes Jerry for Horace in this romantic comedy that received an Academy Award nomination for Best Picture.
link.title: synopsis
The Story of Vernon & Irene Castle
Rhythm on the Range / Rhythm on the River: Double Feature

link.synopsis: Twins Viola (Imogen Stubbs) and Sebastian (Steven Mackintosh) each presume the other is dead after their ship sinks off the shores of Illyria. Disguised as her brother to protect herself better, Viola enters Illyrian society under the name of Cesario, a move which sets into motion a delirious dance of mistaken identity and gender confusion. Director Trevor Nunn transplants the Shakespearean comedy to the Victorian age.
link.title: synopsis
Shakespeare Comedies: As You Like It

link.synopsis: In this sequel to Sebastian Gutierrez's comedy Women in Trouble, Carla Gugino plays Elektra Luxx, a Valley-dwelling Los Angeles porn star who receives the kind of news that few women in her line of work want to hear: She's pregnant. Adrianne Palicki and Joseph Gordon-Levitt reprise their roles from the first film, with Timothy Olyphant and Malin Akerman rounding out the cast of oddball characters.
link.title: synopsis
Sex and the City: The Movie
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
You Don't Mess with the Zohan

link.synopsis: Set during the lean years after World War II, this comedy follows the schemes of a malcontent wife who goads her placid husband into stealing a pig that their country village -- contrary to food rationing laws -- is fattening for slaughter.
link.title: synopsis
The Lonely Passion of Judith Hearne
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun
The Favor, the Watch and the Very Big Fish
How to Get Ahead in Advertising

link.synopsis: Boxer Joe Pendleton (Robert Montgomery) crashes his plane just before a championship fight in this classic fantasy that won Best Story and Screenplay Oscars. Waking in heaven, Joe finds that his spirit has been prematurely snatched from his body. The celestial Mr. Jordan (Claude Rains) sends him back to Earth -- as crooked mogul Bruce Farnsworth. Now, Joe must clean up all of Farnsworth's messes while trying to regain his own career as a boxer.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Cinematography Black and White nominee
category.term: Best Cinematography Black and White nominee

link.title: My Sister Eileen / She Wouldn't Say Yes
No Time for Love / The Egg and I
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
You Can't Take It with You

link.synopsis: A mystical book changes the lives of an independent bookstore's quirky employees and customers by allowing them to undo their biggest blunders in this indie drama that blends mystery, romance, comedy and fantasy. Bookstore manager Dante (Tony Amendola), his ex-lover Zoe (Barbara Crampton), clerks Norman (Ricardo Gil) and Marcia (Shaun Landry), and patron Gina (Catalina Larranaga) are each affected by the events of one extraordinary day.
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Fell to Earth
Timerider: The Adventure of Lyle Swann

link.synopsis: John Lennon and Michael Crawford star in Richard Lester's stylized World War II comedy, a surreal collage of bizarre situations, slapstick humor and authentic newsreel footage that lampoons the absurdity of war. After being captured by German soldiers, woefully inept British Lt. Goodbody (Crawford) recounts the ridiculous misadventures of his army unit, whose members were killed off one by one, thanks to bad luck and his stupid mistakes.
link.title: synopsis
The Knack...and How to Get It
Classic Albums: John Lennon: Plastic Ono Band
Adolf Hitler: My Part in His Downfall
Pete Best: Best of the Beatles
Paul McCartney Really is Dead: The Last Testament of George Harrison
The Last Time I Saw Archie
Who Is Harry Nilsson (And Why Is Everybody Talkin' About Him?)
To Be or Not To Be

link.synopsis: You might know a lot about movies, but "film geek" Scotty Pelk (Melik Malkasian) knows more -- and he isn't afraid to say so. Unfortunately, his outgoing personality isn't winning him points with the ladies, until a pretty hipster named Niko schools him in a subject he knows nothing about. This quirky independent comedy from writer-director James Westby is based in part on Westby's own experiences working in a video store.
link.title: synopsis
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand

link.synopsis: After years apart, a group of idealistic former college buddies (William Hurt, Kevin Kline, Glenn Close, JoBeth Williams, Mary Kay Place, Tom Berenger and Jeff Goldblum) who've followed divergent paths as adults reunite at the funeral of one of their own, reconnecting and reminiscing while a soundtrack of 1960s hits plays in the background. The ensemble performance in this Oscar-nominated dramatic comedy reflected the period's baby boomer angst.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Eddie and the Cruisers II: Eddie Lives
Those Who Love Me Can Take the Train

link.synopsis: Advertising executive Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) is as cocky as they come in director Nancy Meyers's Golden Globe-nominated comedy. But what happens to a chauvinistic guy when he can suddenly hear what women are thinking? Nick gets passed over for a promotion, but after an accident enables him to hear women's thoughts, he puts his newfound talent to work against Darcy (Helen Hunt), his new boss, who seems to be infatuated with him.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days

link.synopsis: Commitment-phobic Julian Winston (Walter Matthau) has been able to keep his girlfriend, Toni (Goldie Hawn), at bay by pretending to be stuck in a loveless marriage. But when Toni insists on meeting his missus, Julian's forced to recruit his assistant (Ingrid Bergman) to pose as his wife. Based on the play by Jean-Pierre Grédy, this lighthearted 1960s-era comedy is directed by filmmaker Gene Saks.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture

link.title: A Guide for the Married Man
There's a Girl in My Soup
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series

link.synopsis: Climbing aboard their mammoth recreational vehicle for a cross-country road trip to the Colorado Rockies, the McNeive family -- led by dysfunctional patriarch Bob (Robin Williams) -- prepares for the adventure of a lifetime. But spending two weeks together in one seriously small space has a way of cramping their style. Jeff Daniels and Tony Award-winning actress Kristin Chenoweth co-star in director Barry Sonnenfeld's raucous vacation comedy.
link.title: synopsis
RV Education 101: Towing Behind Your Motorhome
The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
The Brady Bunch in the White House
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Three Men and a Little Lady

link.synopsis: "The Mikado" -- the crown jewel of Gilbert and Sullivan operettas -- blooms brightly as an on-screen comedy in this performance with actors from Britain's D'Oyly Carte opera company. Nanki-Poo (Kenny Baker), a minstrel who finds his way to the Japanese village of Titi-Pu, meets town executioner Ko-Ko (Martyn Green). But when Nanki-Poo discovers Ko-Ko must perform at least one killing per day, he realizes he may not live to see another day.
link.title: synopsis
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
There's No Business Like Show Business
A Wayfarer's Journey: Listening to Mahler
Note by Note: The Making of Steinway L1037
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: Bank robber Joe Maybe gets himself into a ruse that he might not be able to keep up when he takes on the identity of the U.S. marshal who's trailing him. Joe then takes up residence as a respectable citizen in the town where his old flame lives.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Robert and Hallie hire a sexy couple to house-sit for them while they vacation in the country. But when the house sitters refuse to leave, things get kinky, and what initially feels like a black comedy morphs into a gruesome account of Robert's perverse, mind-swaying nervous breakdown. A master of emotional manipulation, director Jon Reiss draws us into a mysteriously erotic and sadistic inferno of unbridled emotion.
link.title: synopsis
Masters of Horror: John Landis: Deer Woman
Masters of Horror: Lucky McKee: Sick Girl

link.synopsis: This comedy spoof follows a team of far-from-super heroes as they try to overcome their shortcomings and earn respect. Champion City is kept safe by the brave and dashing Captain Amazing, but when he disappears, the Mystery Men spring into action.
link.title: synopsis
InuYasha: The Movie: Affections Touching Across Time

link.synopsis: In director Todd Phillips's raucous comedy, college student Josh (Breckin Meyer) makes two big mistakes: He cheats on his girlfriend -- and videotapes it. When his roommates accidentally mail her the tape, Josh and his buddies hit the road to intercept it. Countless antics occur along the way, including Tom Green feeding a mouse to a boa constrictor. Goofy and surprisingly nonjudgmental, Road Trip co-stars Seann William Scott and Amy Smart.
link.title: synopsis
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Revenge of the Nerds III: The Next Generation
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise

link.synopsis: In director Roger Spottiswoode's farcical comedy, fastidious detective Scott Turner (Tom Hanks) is saddled with a slobbering new partner - a dog named Hooch. The pup's previous owner has been killed, and he and Turner team up to collar the culprit.
link.title: synopsis
The Man with One Red Shoe

link.synopsis: Love and chocolates may yet win the day in this delightful romantic comedy, which follows the slow-burn romance of talented chocolatier Angélique and chocolate-factory owner Jean-René, lonely souls who secretly share a debilitating anxiety disorder.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: In this campy comedy, Vietnam vet Sal -- tortured by his poolboy past -- returns home to find that Mexicans have cornered the pool-cleaning market. Sal sets off on a mission to reclaim his vocation and get revenge on the man who killed his family.
link.title: synopsis
El Superstar: The Unlikely Rise of Juan Frances
Hercules and the Circle of Fire
Hercules in the Maze of the Minotaur
Hercules: Warrior Princess / Gauntlet / Unchained Heart

link.synopsis: Football legend Joe Namath goes "hog wild" as mechanic-turned-outlaw-biker C.C. Ryder, who woos sexy journalist Ann (Ann-Margret) after rescuing her from a rape at the hands of his fellow bikers. William Smith co-stars as brutish gang leader Moon, who frowns upon Ryder's new romance. Fistfights, high-speed races and the open road join forces in this gritty bikesploitation hit filmed in 1970, the year after Namath's legendary Super Bowl victory.
link.title: synopsis
Flatbed Annie and Sweetie Pie: Lady Truckers
Take This Job and Shove It

link.synopsis: Party animal Tommy Callahan (Chris Farley) is a few cans short of a six-pack. But when the family business starts tanking, it's up to Tommy and number-cruncher Richard Hayden (David Spade) to save the day. "Saturday Night Live" stars Farley and Spade take off like rockets in this riotous road comedy, where every wrong turn leads to laughter.
link.title: synopsis
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Chris Farley
To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold

link.synopsis: Just about every person in the neighborhood eventually wants someone dead, even a dull, panic-prone dentist named Oz Ozeransky (Matthew Perry), who is married to monstrous Sophie (Rosanna Arquette) and lives next door to mobster-on-the-run Jimmy "The Tulip" Tudeski (Bruce Willis). Will Sophie get Jimmy to off Oz for insurance money? Michael Clarke Duncan, Natasha Henstridge, Amanda Peet and Kevin Pollak co-star in this slick comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: White cop Hank Rafferty (Steve Zahn) loses his job when a misunderstanding makes it appear he's beating African-American police wannabe Earl Montgomery (Martin Lawrence). And when Hank is released and gets a security guard gig, he's stunned to see his new partner is Earl. Still stinging from Earl's false accusations, Hank agrees to put aside his hostility when he and Earl team up to shut down a complex smuggling ring in this zany action comedy.
link.title: synopsis
What's the Worst That Could Happen?

link.synopsis: Sometimes, the pursuit of happiness leads you to places you least expect. That's the premise behind this romantic comedy starring Colin Firth as a British artist who heads for America when his girlfriend (Minnie Driver) marries another man.
link.title: synopsis
When Did You Last See Your Father?
Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day

link.synopsis: Camp Hope is a summer retreat for overweight boys run by a kindly couple who make the campers feel comfortable with their extra pounds. But when tyrannical fitness guru Tony (Ben Stiller) buys the camp, he puts the kids on a cruel regimen that goes too far. Sick of the endless weeks of "all work and no play," the kids stage a coup and reclaim their summer of fun. Tom McGowan and Aaron Schwartz star in this Judd Apatow-penned comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Special agent Harry Tasker (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is a top spy in the ultra-secret Omega Sector -- but his wife (Jamie Lee Curtis) thinks he's just a boring computer salesman. When Harry's identities collide, the Taskers find themselves in the clutches of international terrorists, fighting to save their marriage and their lives. Director James Cameron's action comedy adds romance and special effects to the Oscar-nominated mix.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.synopsis: Filmed live during two concerts at Madison Square Garden, this stand-up comedy classic showcases Eddie Murphy in a series of uproarious celebrity impressions, observations about the 1980s, remembrances of his childhood and much more. Directed by filmmaker Robert Townsend (Hollywood Shuffle), this feature-length release proves that Murphy's talents are on par with comedic legends like Richard Pryor and George Carlin.
link.title: synopsis
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy
Richard Pryor: I Ain't Dead Yet #*%$#@!! Uncensored
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Jamie Foxx: Straight from the Foxxhole
George Carlin: Playing with Your Head

link.synopsis: Having lost the girl of his dreams, Anderson (Jason Biggs) accepts a dare to jump back into the dating scene by proposing marriage to the next girl he sees -- a love-starved waitress named Katie (Isla Fisher), who accepts on a whim. But the road to true love might not be as thorny as the couple once thought. Written and directed by Michael Ian Black, this charming romantic comedy also stars Joe Pantoliano, Mark Consuelos and Michael Weston.
link.title: synopsis
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Sex and the City: The Movie
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human

link.synopsis: Georgia Nicolson (Georgia Groome) has two goals in life: Get a gorgeous boyfriend, and throw the best 15th birthday party … ever. No. 1 looks within reach when hottie Robbie (Aaron Johnson) arrives in school. That is, until Georgia's archnemesis is spotted with him. Adding to Georgia's troubles are some serious family problems back home. Luckily, she's got her cat Angus and her best mates in the Ace Gang in this winning British teen comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2

link.synopsis: Suffering from amnesia after an occupational hazard, a mild-mannered janitor (Cedric the Entertainer) is fooled into believing he's an undercover agent and stumbles into an international arms ring plot that involves both the CIA and the FBI. He also meets a sexy federal agent (Lucy Liu) who can't help falling for him, despite his delusions. Nicollette Sheridan co-stars in this comedy of mistaken identity directed by Les Mayfield (Encino Man).
link.title: synopsis
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
Get Smart's Bruce & Lloyd Out of Control
The Man with One Red Shoe
Cedric the Entertainer: Taking You Higher
You Don't Mess with the Zohan

link.synopsis: Three high school freshmen devise a novel plan for dealing with the treacherous school bully: They hire a bodyguard. Salvation comes in the form of Drillbit Taylor (Owen Wilson), a beach bum ex-soldier who teaches the boys some handy life lessons. Leslie Mann co-stars as an English teacher in this hilarious underdog romp co-written by Seth Rogen and based on an original idea by teen-comedy god John Hughes.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion
Girls Just Want to Have Fun
Bring It On: All or Nothing

link.synopsis: An out-of-this-world girl band has a chance for their shot at the big time -- if they can manage to get to the galaxy's hottest night spot, the Radioactive Dream, in time for their gig in this campy sci-fi comedy. But first, they'll have to fight their way through a meteor field, deal with a crash landing on a deserted planet and manage a very angry Venusian Man-Beast who's escaped on his way to prison.
link.title: synopsis
The Gore Gore Girls: Special Edition
Bachelor Party in the Bungalow of the Damned

link.synopsis: Though he always dreamed of a singing career, first-generation Italian-American Frank Gregorio (Chazz Palminteri) obeyed his parents' wishes and became a psychiatrist. But when a patient introduces Frank to karaoke, a long-buried passion is quickly resurrected. Co-starring Drea de Matteo as Frank's daughter Lana, who's going through a midlife crisis of her own, this big-hearted comedy premiered at the 2009 Sundance Film Festival.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: This fanciful comedy stars Shirley MacLaine as Harriet Blossom, the neglected wife of brassiere manufacturer Robert (Richard Attenborough), whose passion in life is music. Harriet's boredom is solved when she hides Ambrose Tuttle (James Booth), one of Robert's workers, in the attic. Harriet and Ambrose enjoy a love affair for several years, during which detectives search for him, and Robert is driven to a nervous breakdown by the noises overhead.
link.title: synopsis
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Worst Week of My Life
The Man in the White Suit
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
The Knack...and How to Get It

link.synopsis: This cross between a sketch comedy show and a biting satire of 1970s television features a variety of hilariously crude commercials, politically incorrect TV shows and other outrageously offensive faux programming. As telethons for perverts, ads featuring the electric chair and other tasteless chaff fill the airwaves, America's irate president (George Furth) and his advisors try to shut down the transmission.
link.title: synopsis
The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington
The Nine Lives of Fritz the Cat
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood

link.synopsis: Basu Chatterjee directs this romantic comedy about fortunate misunderstandings. When wealthy industrialist Sandeep Anand (Mithun Chakraborty) crosses paths with the beautiful theater actress Geeta (Rati Agnihotri), the theater company owner capitalizes on the free publicity. He spreads rumors that the two are an item and that the rich patron is sponsoring the show. The gossip causes much confusion, hilarity and possibly ... love?
link.title: synopsis
Beats of the Heart: There'll Always Be Stars in the Sky: The Indian Film Music Phenomenon
